item.title: Dragon Age: The Veilguard - 6 Things To Look Forward To
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Legacy characters will return in The Veilguard, including Lace Harding, Varric, Morrigan, and Maevaris.
  • Dragon Age fans can look forward to improved character customization with impressive hair physics and new options.
  • New settings in Tevinter, pansexual romances, and enhanced combat with new specializations are just a few aspects that fans should get excited about.

The time has finally come: The next Dragon Age entry has been announced and is now coming up to its release day, ten years after the last game. It's been a long-time coming for fans, and their patience has been awarded with several trailers showcasing just some of these things the game has on offer, though BioWare is keeping several things under wraps for fans to find out for themselves.

With the release date fast approaching and many likely already having their pre-order secured, it is time to hop on the hype train and celebrate the exciting tidbits that are sure to make Dragon Age: The Veilguard a stand-out entry in BioWare's vast catalog of creations.

6 The Return Of Legacy Characters

Iconic Series Favorites Are Returning To Reprise Their Roles

One of the first nuggets of news was the announcement of the new companions players would be fighting alongside, and though the fans received these characters well (with some already picking out their favorites), there were hopes of legacy characters returning, and BioWare did not disappoint.

Thus far, there is confirmation of Lace Harding, Varric Tethras, Morrigan, and Maevaris Tilani returning in Veilguard. The former three are from previous games, Inquistion , 2 and Origins respectively, and Maevaris is a celebrated character from spin-off works such as Those Who Speak . It is unknown if other fan-favorite characters will return, but it is likely that there will be mentions of the previous heroes and their chosen beaus at the very least. Time will only tell if BioWare has sneaked more cameos in behind gamers' backs.

5 Improved Character Customization

The New Hair Reveal Has Characters Looking Salon-Fresh

Some lucky journalists got their hands on exclusive Dragon Age: The Veilguard demos, and what was shown were some truly impressive hair physics and a breathtakingly beautiful Rook. Dragon Age has a rather sordid past with character customization, specifically with the hair options (or rather, the lack thereof). Many can forgive Origins due to the age of the game, as customization back then was a unicorn. Dragon Age 2 showed some improvements, but most chose the default Hawke, as they looked better than what anyone could come up with outside of mods. Inquisition remains a sore spot for many fans still.

Fans' prayers have finally been answered, however, and things are finally looking up for character customization enthusiasts. Though there haven't been any in-depth reveals, fans have seen the impressive hair physics showcasing some decent hairstyles finally. Now, players can finally make a salon-fresh character in a Dragon Age game, whose perfect hair could likely only be put down to magic use. Whatever the reason, the mere possibility of decent customization options is incredibly exciting.

4 Brand-New Locations

Players Will Visit A Previously Unexplored Setting

Thus far, players have had quite a tour of Thedas, from Fereldan to Kirkwall and then to numerous different places in Inquisition , such as The Hinterlands, which fans will likely remember the most. There were wonders about where the new game would take place, with BioWare confirming the main location to be Tevinter when the game was still titled Dragon Age: Dreadwolf . Though the name of the game has changed, the location has not, and the Imperium is still the main location.

There is plenty of rich lore surrounding this location, which will certainly have some interesting implications for Rook and co, as well as the plot at large. Though Tevinter has featured in other Dragon Age works, this will still be the first chance players have of walking through this region themselves, which will be a very exciting prospect for long-time fans of the franchise.

3 No Gender-Locked Romances

Rook Is Free To Woo Whoever They Please

Origins kicked the series off with a mere four romances, and two of those four were locked to the opposite gender, stealing many players' dream paramour. 2 evened the playing field, featuring only one character who was gender-locked, which fans highlighted as one of the game's strengths. Inquisition took a step back, and though it had more romance options overall, not everyone was content with the choices available to them.

BioWare seems to have finally learned their lesson, as every single one of the possible romance choices are pansexual, assuaging the fears players had that the one they wanted was off the table. Though there are arguments to be made about the lack of representation within an all-pansexual cast, there is nothing stopping companions who are not romanced by the Rook to find love with one another or for there to be more diverse sexualities among the NPCs. But either way, this was still the best move to be made, as now, everyone can rest assured the companion of their dreams is 100% romanceable.

2 Exciting Gameplay

Players Have Been Promised More Engaging Action

Dragon Age has seen several gameplay shifts throughout the series. Origins took a more turn-based approach, 2 embraced hack-and-slash elements, and Inquisition tried to find a balance between the two, but most players would have defaulted to button-mashing. BioWare has overhauled the combat system for their next outing, reducing the party size for a more involved experience and doing away with the tactical camera to force players to think quickly and remain on their toes.

Classes are returning in the form of warrior, mage, and rogue, and players can spec into a subclass with fairly in-depth skill trees, so now, one type of character feels the same to play. There has also been the new addition of being able to boot an enemy off a ledge Baldur's Gate 3 -style, which could result in some hilarious premature boss executions. Combat is rarely ever the highlight of a Dragon Age game, but from everything revealed so far, Veilguard looks like it might just be changing that.

1 New Specializations

Veilguard Introduces New Sublasses To The Series

The Dragon Age series always remains faithful to three classes: Warrior, Mage and Rogue, each with its own playstyle and specializations to choose from, encouraging gamers to consider a second playthrough so that they can experience combat from a different point of view. These traditional classes continue with Veilguard , but brand-new specializations have been introduced specific for the upcoming title, with some even involving the eponymous veil.

The confirmed specializations for each class are as follows:

  • Mage - Death Caller, Spell Blade, Evoker
  • Rogue - Duelist, Saboteur, Veil Ranger, Veil Jumpers
  • Warrior - Champion, Grey Warden, Reaper, Slayer

With so many new specs and the return of legendary factions such as Grey Wardens, there is something here for everyone. The collection of exciting abilities are also likely to make the combat of Veilguard more fun than previous Dragon Age games.

item.title: Genshin Impact: How To Get The Sharpshooter On Hand Commission Hidden Achievement
item.description:
As Genshin Impact players venture into Natlan, they will encounter various opportunities to obtain rewards and achievements. Natlan is jam packed with hidden achievements for Genshin Impact players to get, and some of them are hidden within daily commissions.

In Natlan, daily commissions can be unlocked after completing the main Archon Quest, 'Chapter V Flowers Resplendent on a Sun-Scorched Sojourn,' as well as the side quest, 'Red Hot Adventure!' After speaking to Kathryne and waiting for the daily reset, all players need to do is wait for the Sharpshooter on Hand commission.

Sharpshooter On Hand Daily Commission - Genshin Impact

This Genshin Impact commission tasks players with speaking to Zicheng over at the Stadium of Sacred Flames and helping him with some pictures. He’s looking for some inspiration in three places, and if players complete the main AND side task , only then will they receive the hidden achievement. The main task is already given, but the side task isn’t.

Each of the three places is randomly generated and purely depends on the players. The locations can be found in the Scions of the Canopy tribe, Children of Echoes tribe, and the People of the Springs tribe. Depending on what Zicheng says, head to the indicated location and first take a picture of the main task in the allocated time. Afterward, head to the side task indicated below and take a picture as well.

Djembe Studios - People Of The Springs

If players need to go to Djembe Studios for the main task, they should keep in mind that there are two side tasks to complete here in order to receive the achievement . When you get there, make sure to change the time and then take a picture of the first stall. Next, head to the other two stalls in the images provided and take pictures of them at the same allocated time . Your camera frame should indicate that what you are doing is correct.

  • Main Task: Take a picture of Djembe Studios
  • Side Task: Take a picture of two other famous stores and their signboards.

The two locations for the side tasks are:

  • Xochicuicatl Records - Pakaa Nui NPC
  • Atlahua’s Net - Yelafath NPC

Stage Tepetl - Children Of The Echoes

If players receive this commission, they need to head to the Children of Echoes tribe and complete the main and side tasks there as well. Luckily, there is only one side task.

  • Main Task: Take a picture of Stage Tepetl
  • Side Task: Take a picture of the large gemstone shop.

Incase players didn’t already know, Stage Tepetl is the big stage in the Children of Echoes tribe where NPCs perform dance battles. It's diagonally across the reputation waypoint, so simply fly over and take a picture. After you have completed that, head to the opposite side and find the gemstone. This is the same Gem Shop where Imix is located .

Make sure to take a picture at the allocated time and have all the gems shown in the picture .

The picture doesn’t count if all the gems aren’t there. This includes the gems on top of the box near the edge of the cliff.

Courier’s Longhouse - Scions Of The Canopy

If players receive the Courier’s Longhouse one, there is only one side task to complete here as well. Simply head to the Scions of the Canopy tribe and complete the main task at the allocated time.

  • Main Task: Take a picture of Courier’s Longhouse
  • Side Task: Take a photo of the huge mural

The side task is actually near the main teleportation waypoint in the area. Just turn around and you’ll find a mural of a Yumkasaur . Take a picture of it within the same timeframe, and then head back to Zicheng.

After completing whichever variation of this commission you have received, go back to Zicheng and speak to him. He’ll then give you the achievement after doing so.

item.title: New Switch Co-Op Game is Inspired by Donkey Kong Country
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Nikoderiko: The Magical World launches in October for multiple platforms, offering retro Donkey Kong vibes.
  • The game features diverse gameplay with 3D and 2D mechanics, boss fights, and collectibles.
  • With a soundtrack arranged by David Wise and comparisons to classic platformers, Nikoderiko targets old-school and new gamers.

Fans of the Donkey Kong Country series will soon have a new adventure platformer to experience when Nikoderiko: The Magical World launches in October. The colorful title will be available on Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S and looks to bring back the retro gaming vibes of the beloved Donkey Kong side-scrolling franchise.

Audiences have recently been treated to Astro Bot on PlayStation 5, which has been heavily praised for its old-school 3D platforming gameplay and light-hearted storytelling. For fans seeking more titles with classic gaming vibes and lovable leading characters, this mysterious new adventure coming in October seeks to offer up another exciting experience.

VEA Games and Knights Peak have revealed that the upcoming action-adventure platformer Nikoderiko: The Magical World will be making its way to consoles on October 15, with future plans for release on PC. Nikoderiko will feature familiar gameplay to classic platformers like Crash Bandicoot , Banjo-Kazooie , and Donkey Kong Country , with a mix of both 3D and 2D mechanics. Players will guide anthropomorphic protagonists Niko and Luna on a magical journey through a vibrant world of expansive areas with diverse gameplay themes such as minecart sections, chase sequences, and underwater exploration. In addition to the similar gameplay premise, British composer David Wise, who worked on the soundtrack for the original Donkey Kong Country trilogy, arranged all the music for Nikoderiko: The Magical World .

Nikoderiko: The Magical World Launch Trailer

For fans of Donkey Kong Country , Nikoderiko: The Magical World looks to act as an unofficial spiritual successor to the iconic ape adventure franchise. In the launch trailer for Nikoderiko , fans get a detailed look at the gameplay, which shifts between 3D environments and 2D gameplay segments. Audiences can also spot some of the collectibles that will be available, such as the NIKO letters, which act as a callback to the KONG letters that can be gathered in the Donkey Kong Country series. Epic boss fights, rideable animal mounts, loveable battle allies, optional couch co-op and more lie in wait for adventurous players looking to jump into the world of Nikoderiko: The Magical World when it launches in October.

Recent years have seen a notable resurgence in popularity for retro-style platforming video games, perhaps suggesting that audiences appreciate a variety of options from both AAA and indie developers. With Astro Bot continuing to impress fans, Nikoderiko: The Magical World aims to find similar success among old-school gaming fans and new audiences alike.

item.title: Every Rockstar Studio, Ranked
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Rockstar Games has multiple studios, with Rockstar North being the largest and most famous, known for GTA titles.
  • Rockstar San Diego is behind Red Dead Redemption, the Midnight Club, and collaborates on other titles.
  • Rockstar India, a newer branch, supports Rockstar Games with the development of major titles.

Rockstar Games has made history throughout the years with the smashing hits the developer has released and the franchises it's built. Millions of players constantly look forward to most of the titles this developer releases, hoping for the amazing game mechanics, deep stories, and attention to detail that they've come to expect.

While every Rockstar Games studio and subsidiary deserves praise and recognition for the efforts of the people working within them, some of them have been tasked with larger projects than others. This results in wider recognition among the fanbase, and likely more funding to develop further titles. Here's every Rockstar Studio ranked .

9 Rockstar North

GTA 5, GTA : Vice City, GTA: San Andreas

  • Known for being the main developer of most of the company's smash hits
  • Acquired by Rockstar Games in 1988

Rockstar North is probably the most famous branch of the monster developer that has been taking the gaming world by storm for over two decades now. Located in Edinburgh, Scotland, this behemoth has released games including, but not limited to, GTA 3 , GTA: Vice City , GTA: San Andreas , GTA 4 , and GTA 5 .

With a reported 650 employees in 2018, Rockstar North is the largest branch of Rockstar Games and is likely the one with the most funding. It was acquired in 1999 and has served a pivotal role in the company's franchises and projects since then.

8 Rockstar San Diego

Red Dead Redemption Franchise, Midnight Club Series, L.A. Noire (Collaboration)

  • Over 300 employees
  • Credited for being the main developer behind the Red Dead Redemption franchise

While gargantuan projects like Red Dead Redemption 2 and other installments of the franchise require the joint efforts of several different branches of the company, Rockstar San Diego is credited as the main developer for these titles. This team was behind the creation of the iconic John Marston, Arthur Morgan, and the Van der Linde Gang, which is not a small accomplishment.

Rockstar San Diego is also credited for developing the Midnight Club series, Smuggler's Run , and collaborating in the development of L.A. Noire. While not as large as the Rockstar North division, San Diego still has over 300 employees, which is a considerable number.

7 Rockstar Toronto

Max Payne 3, Several GTA PC Ports

  • Main developer behind Max Payne 3, Manhunt 2, and more
  • Collaborator in the development of the GTA 5 PC port, and several others

While Rockstar Toronto hasn't been involved in as many flagship products as its bigger siblings, it has still contributed greatly to the developer's game history and success. Being one of the main developers for titles, such as Max Payne 3 , Manhunt 2 , and collaborators in the development of the GTA 5 PC port, they also deserve one of the top spots on the list.

With over 200 employees and a very diverse portfolio, Rockstar Toronto deserves a lot of praise as one of the building blocks of Rockstar Games' success.

6 Rockstar New York

Used Mainly As A Strong Support Studio For Rockstar Game's Global Releases

  • A major supporter of most of Rockstar Games' titles
  • Medium-sized branch

Rockstar New York has not been credited with as many solo projects as other branches on this list, but that doesn't mean it's not important. In fact, this branch plays a critical piece in Rockstar Games' success, as it's one of the most important support studios in the company's large portfolio.

Without Rockstar New York, it's very likely that many of the company's most iconic titles, such as Red Dead Redemption 2 , and GTA 5 would have been delayed for months or even years. With an employee count of about 150 employees, this branch isn't huge, but it isn't tiny either.

5 Rockstar Lincoln

One Of The Largest Quality Assurance Stations For Rockstar Games

  • The studio focuses on quality control and ironing out bugs
  • The branch is estimated to have about 200 employees

Just like Rockstar New York plays a critical role in helping the rest of the company's team to develop massive games that take years to make, Rockstar Lincoln is proud to be a branch that, among other things, specializes in quality assurance.

This studio ensures that all the company's products meet the high-quality standards Rockstar Games is known for, ironing out bugs and other issues before releasing any game. Without them, most of the iconic titles made by the company would likely have had a lot more problems.

4 Rockstar Leeds

GTA: Liberty City Stories, GTA: Vice City Stories

  • Credited for helping develop GTA: Vice City Stories and GTA: Liberty City Stories
  • The branch has around 100 employees.

Back in the olden days of GTA: Vice City and GTA 3 , titles like GTA: Liberty City Stories , and GTA: Vice City Stories served as amazing prequels that helped set the foundation of future games and answer many of the games' questions. None of this would have been possible without the efforts of the Rockstar Leeds branch, as it's credited for being one of the main developers behind these prequels.

Rockstar Leeds has also been credited with being a collaborator in the development of many of the GTA franchise's mobile releases.

3 Rockstar India

Major Supporter In The Development Of GTA 5 updates, Red Dead Redemption 2, And More

  • A relatively new studio that opened in 2016
  • It has between 700–1000 employees

Everybody knows that India is one of the most important countries when it comes to technological development and startups, which is why Rockstar Games has trusted Rockstar India with helping during the development of many of the company's most expensive and successful titles to date.

While this branch isn't credited with developing any full games on its own, they are credited with being one of the largest collaborators across a wide range of Rockstar Games' projects. This branch is significantly newer than others on the list, as it was established in 2016. It's estimated to have between 700–1000 employees.

2 Rockstar London

Manhunt 2, And Supporting Roles In Max Payne 3, and Midnight Club: Los Angeles

  • Founded in 2005
  • Led the development of Manhunt 2

Like other titles on this list, Rockstar London has had more of a supportive role in terms of the development of many of the company's smash hits. However, it is credited as one of the leaders in the development of Manhunt 2, and for playing an important role in the development of Max Payne 3 , and the Midnight Club series.

While this branch isn't as new as Rockstar India, it is newer than others like Rockstar North, as it was established in 2005, right at the peak of the first GTA: San Andreas.

1 Rockstar New England

Bully: Scholarship Edition, Supporting Role In The Development Of Red Dead Redemption 2, And GTA 5

  • Significant role in porting games to different platforms
  • Supporter in the development of GTA 5 and Red Dead Redemption 2

Along with Rockstar Vancouver (now Rockstar Toronto), Rockstar New England worked on the enhanced version of the critically acclaimed PS2 game, Bully . it has also played a considerable supporting role in the development of GTA 5 and Red Dead Redemption 2 . It might seem surprising that so many Rockstar Games' branches collaborate on large projects at the same time, but considering how hard high-quality games are to make, it makes a lot of sense.

Rockstar New England is also credited with helping to port many of the company's games to different platforms for a wider audience.

item.title: Disney Dreamlight Valley: How to Pick Berries From the Beach
item.description:
The latest Dapper Delights Star Path has brought many new riddles for saviors to complete in Gameloft’s 2022 life sim Disney Dreamlight Valley. Some of them ask you to feed critters, and give gifts to villagers, while others require you to collect certain items. One of these duties is to ‘Pick Berries From the Beach.’

There are different berries in the game, like Strawberries, Raspberries, Blueberries, and Cactoberries, which might make it hard to figure out which ones count for this Star Path duty. For now, we know that these special berries are native to the beach. Keep reading this guide to find out how to complete the ‘Pick Berries From the Beach’ duty in DDV.

How to Pick Berries From the Beach in Dreamlight Valley

So the beach area is Dazzle Beach and the berries you are looking for Blueberries . These are the only berries that spawn on Dazzle Beach, along with other fruits like banana and coconut. To complete this Star Path duty, you'll need to collect 40 Blueberries from Dazzle Beach.

First, Dreamers need to enter the Dazzle Beach biome. This area costs 1,000 Dreamlight to unlock, which you can use to clear the Night Thorns blocking the way. Completing Dreamlight Duties is a great way to earn this currency.

​​

After unlocking Dazzle Beach, go in and find blueberry bushes. These bushes are dark green with blue berries hanging on them. Just interact with the bushes to pick the berries. Players will get three blueberries with each harvest. The bushes will need 25 minutes to grow back , and like other bushes in the valley, you don’t need to water them.

A quick heads-up: Dazzle Beach only has three blueberry bushes, which means you can only pick up to 9 blueberries in one go . To increase the chances of gathering more berries, players should bring a villager friend with the foraging role.

Players can also find blueberries in the Forest of Valor, but only the ones from Dazzle Beach count for this Star Path Duty. Once you have picked 40 blueberries from Dazzle Beach, you’ll complete this task and earn 10 Lily Pad Tokens . Dreamers can use these tokens to unlock premium rewards from the Dapper Delights event.

Besides the Star Path task, you can use Blueberries to make tasty dishes like Blueberry Pie, Stitch Cupcake, Basil Berry Salad, and Chrysanthemum Tea. Eating them raw restores 350 energy points, and players can also sell them for 29 Star Coins at Goofy’s Stall.
